item.description: Talks Hilbert Class Field and Artin’s Symbol This lecture was part of the seminar on Explicit Class Field Theory taught in the first semester at PUC. It introduces the concepts of place, ramification, Hilbert class fields, and the Artin symbol. Seminars Seminar on Galois representations and their $L$-functions Extras Underdegree’s tesis
item.content:encoded:
Talks

  • Hilbert Class Field and Artin’s Symbol This lecture was part of the seminar on Explicit Class Field Theory taught in the first semester at PUC. It introduces the concepts of place, ramification, Hilbert class fields, and the Artin symbol.

Seminars

  • Seminar on Galois representations and their $L$-functions

Extras

  • Underdegree’s tesis

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
item.content:encoded:
Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

In this example we will be using KaTeX

  • Create a partial under /layouts/partials/math.html
  • Within this partial reference the Auto-render Extension or host these scripts locally.
  • Include the partial in your templates like so:
1{{ if or .Params.math .Site.Params.math }}
2{{ partial "math.html" . }}
3{{ end }}
  • To enable KaTex globally set the parameter math to true in a project’s configuration
  • To enable KaTex on a per page basis include the parameter math: true in content files

Note: Use the online reference of Supported TeX Functions

Examples

Block math: $$ \varphi = 1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\cdots} } } $$

item.description: Seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$-functions (2023-2) Organizers Héctor Pastén and Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo Description The seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$-functions aims to learn tools from group representation theory with an emphasis on applications to number theory, specifically oriented towards the Tate Conjecture. Schedule 2023-2 The seminar was held on Fridays at 9:40 am in Room 5 of the Faculty of Mathematics, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.
item.content:encoded:
Seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$-functions (2023-2)

Organizers Héctor Pastén and Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo

Description The seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$-functions aims to learn tools from group representation theory with an emphasis on applications to number theory, specifically oriented towards the Tate Conjecture.

Schedule 2023-2 The seminar was held on Fridays at 9:40 am in Room 5 of the Faculty of Mathematics, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.

Talks (For now, the notes are in Spanish)

  • Talk 1 (01/09) Héctor Pastén: Introduction to Galois representations.
  • Talk 2 (08/09) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Galois Theory: Basic Tools.
  • Talk 3 (15/09) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Representations of Finite Groups: Basic Tools.
  • Talk 4 (22/09) Benjamín Castillo: Frobenius Element: Basic Constructions from Algebraic Number Theory.
  • Talk 5 (29/09) Matías Alvarado: Examples of Frobenius elements.
  • Talk 6 (13/10) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Dirichlet $L$-functions and their Analytical Properties.
  • Talk 7 (20/10) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Artin $L$-functions and their Analytical Properties.
  • Talk 8 (03/11) Patricio Pérez: Brauer’s Theorem for Induced Characters.
  • Talk 9 (17/11) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Artin Formalism.
  • Talk 10 (24/11) Héctor Pastén: Analytical Properties of Artin $L$-functions.
